intro: Brathys acicularis, commonly known as the needleleaf brathys, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
